Why Mozilla?

Mozilla Corporation is the non-profit-backed technology company that has shaped the internet for the better over the last 25 years. We make pioneering brands like Firefox, the privacy-minded web browser, and Pocket, a service for keeping up with the best content online. Now, with more than 225 million people around the world using our products each month, we’re shaping the next 25 years of technology and helping to reclaim an internet built for people, not companies. Our work focuses on diverse areas including AI, social media, security and more. And we’re doing this while never losing our focus on our core mission – to make the internet better for people. 

The Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the non-profit 501(c) Mozilla Foundation. This means we aren’t beholden to any shareholders — only to our mission. Along with thousands of volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozillians design, build and distribute open-source software that enables people to enjoy the internet on their terms. 

About this team and role:

Mozilla IT is seeking an outstanding Senior HRIS Application Engineer to accelerate our journey toward streamlining Human Resource (HR) experiences for Mozillians, and boost our highly competent team of HRIS experts. You will be responsible for developing, proposing and implementing Workday integrations, tenant fixes and enhancements. The role is a key resource in providing technical support of our Workday instance in areas including, but not limited to, absence module, tenant tuning, data integrity, and dashboard development that support People systems administration. Someone who enjoys working with different teams and determining the best solution to address their needs and make them more successful. Someone who is passionate about learning and innovation, loves to experiment to find the best way to solve customers’ problems. You will evaluate the business needs, evaluate the current process for continuous improvement and deploy scalable solutions to meet the needs. 

What you’ll do: 

  • Conduct regular audits of system security, access, permissions, and approvals; identify areas of improvement; and collaborate with the People Team and other groups and business units to ensure expert use and management of data
  • Respond to critical requests by clarifying the need and setting realistic expectations about feature delivery
  • Create and manage a catalog of reports and dashboards to drive consistent data representation among all users
  • Create audit processes and reports to ensure compliance and data integrity
  • Configure and enhance business processes, integrations, and system-related governance
  • Support HR system requests including gathering requirements, system configuration, design and development of integrations, executing tests, implementation, and training efforts
  • Diagnose system problems and implement thoughtful solutions
  • Serve as the Workday SME to support initiatives from the People Team and multi-functional partners
  • Act as a consultant to stakeholders in the development of concepts by clarifying the business case, assessing feasibility, scope, and resource requirements
  • Drive and support release management by assessing readiness, and the impact to downstream systems and change management
  • Maintain detailed, up-to-date process documentation and manage change management, as required
  • Assist with end user KT or trainings
  • Ask insightful questions and provide constructive feedback
  • Anticipate needs and draw from past experiences to offer solutions
  • Maintain relationships with key business partners to manage issues as they arise and provide timely support

What you’ll bring: 

  • 5+ years of experience in implementation, enhancement, and/or technical support of Workday Core HCM and supplemental modules and multi-system integrations
  • Hands-on Workday HCM configuration and reporting capabilities
  • Workday Pro Certifications (HCM, Reporting, Integrations, Security); Workday Studio experience strongly preferred
  • Experience with EIBs, both in and outbound both for BPs and third-party tools
  • 3+ years of experience with Greenhouse Applicant Tracking System highly preferred
  • Ability to handle highly sensitive data with integrity
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills including complex formulas, pivot tables, and VBA
  • Flexibility to pivot quickly both within and between projects
  • Effective written and oral communication skills
  • Able to work well in both team and individual environments
  • Commitment to our values:
    • Welcoming differences
    • Being relationship-minded
    • Practicing responsible participation
    • Having grit

What you’ll get:

  • Generous performance-based bonus plans to all eligible employees - we share in our success as one team
  • Rich medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Generous retirement contributions with 100% immediate vesting (regardless of whether you contribute)
  • Quarterly all-company wellness days where everyone takes a pause together
  • Country specific holidays plus a day off for your birthday
  • One-time home office stipend
  • Annual professional development budget
  • Quarterly well-being stipend

When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.  We’re not a normal tech company. The things we create prioritize people and their privacy over profits. We exist to make the internet a healthier,  happier place for everyone.

title: Senior Proposal Writer
description:
AffirmedRx is on a mission to improve health care outcomes by bringing clarity, integrity, and trust to pharmacy benefit management. We are committed to making pharmacy benefits easy to understand, straightforward to access and always in the best interest of employers and the lives they impact. We accomplish this by bringing total clarity to business practices, leading with clinical approaches, and utilizing state-of-the-art technology.
Join us in improving health care outcomes for all!  We promise to do what’s right, always.


Position Summary:
As a Senior Proposal Writer at AffirmedRx, you will play a pivotal role in driving business growth by applying proposal best practices to respond to various client and prospect requests. These include RFPs, RFIs, BAFOs, capability documents, and other customized requests. Your expertise will contribute to winning new business, renewing existing contracts, and representing AffirmedRx’s commitment to excellence.

What you will do:

Proposal Development and Management:

•    Take ownership of assigned proposal tasks, managing day-to-day activities to deliver high-quality work
•    Establish and manage project timelines, ensuring timely completion of tasks and adherence to deadlines
•    Work within a proposal collaboration tool to organize and populate content effectively
•    Support supplemental projects and administrative tasks related to proposal development

Content Creation and Customization:

•    Write, edit, and refine proposal content to ensure clarity, relevance, and alignment with client needs
•    Research prospects to tailor content to their industry, challenges, and culture
•    Format and finalize proposals to reflect AffirmedRx’s brand and professional standards
•    Review and copyedit materials developed by peers and colleagues to maintain consistency and quality

Collaboration and Communication:

•    Collaborate closely with proposal team members, Sales, Pricing, and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs)
•    Partner with internal teams to create visually compelling graphical representations of written material
•    Participate in database updates to maintain accurate and current proposal content

Process Improvement and Quality Assurance:

•    Identify opportunities for continuous improvement in proposal development processes
•    Ensure consistency, accuracy, and compliance with proposal guidelines and best practices
•    Maintain a proactive approach to refining workflows for efficiency and effectiveness
•    Ensure all deliverables meet AffirmedRx’s high standards for content and presentation


What you need:
•    Bachelor’s degree in in English, Communications, Marketing, Healthcare Administration, or equivalent experience required
•    5-7 years of experience in proposal writing, preferably within the pharmacy benefit management (PBM) or healthcare industry
•    Strong service-oriented mindset with high personal standards and a proactive, hands-on work style
•    Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks, deadlines, and shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment
•    Positive and professional demeanor, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams and personalities
•    Membership in the Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP) or a willingness to obtain it
•    Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a strong command of English grammar and syntax
•    Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
•    Excellent organizational skills with the ability to meet multiple deadlines efficiently
•    Strong problem-solving abilities, with the capability to analyze challenges and present clear, actionable solutions

What you get:
•    To impact industry change in the pharmacy benefits management space, while delivering the highest quality patient outcomes
•    To work in a culture where people thrive because when OUR team thrives, OUR business thrives
•    Competitive compensation, including health, dental, vision and other benefits


Note:  
AffirmedRx is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. Remote employees are expected to maintain a professional work environment free of distractions to ensure optimal performance and collaboration.

Summary

The Wikimedia vision is a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge, and the People Growth & Belonging Team leads the Wikimedia Foundation’s effort to provide staff with the tools, opportunities, and learning materials needed to shape a welcoming and supportive workplace environment where everyone has the chance to thrive. 

This role will report into the Manager, People Growth & Belonging and is fully remote. The candidate will work closely with the wider People Growth & Belonging team to shape and drive key learning and development initiatives, including leadership development, staff upskilling, and global event learning tracks. They will lead strategy development, stakeholder engagement, and vendor partnerships while designing and executing programs that enhance the staff experience at the Wikimedia Foundation. This role will also collaborate with the broader People Department to develop, implement, assess, and continuously improve the organization’s staff development, organizational learning, and orientation programs.

You are responsible for:

  • Leading the strategic design and implementation of our flagship, in-person leadership development program, ensuring its alignment with organizational goals and its impact on leadership capabilities. Act as the primary program lead, integrating content development, stakeholder alignment, and execution while managing vendors, logistics, and evaluation efforts.
  • Owning the design and execution of staff up-skilling initiatives and development funds offered to our staff, overseeing vendor partnerships, internal communications strategy, training facilitation, and program measurement to drive engagement and continuous improvement.
  • Being a learning design partner and advisor for our upcoming global, in-person staff gathering, shaping the learning track vision and working closely with project teams, and vendors to ensure high-impact sessions that align with organizational priorities.
  • Being a learning design partner and a project coordinator for a Foundation-wide initiative to foster constructive interactions across lines of difference, collaborating with the project team, the project manager and with vendors to shape and deliver successful provisions which will ultimately help staff co-create spaces to have dialogue on various topics with respect and care for diversity of thought.
  • Providing thought leadership and execution on instructional design, curriculum development, and facilitation techniques to elevate internal learning experiences across the organization.
  • Being a facilitator for internal learning as needed.

Skills and Experience:

  • Proven ability to manage multiple, complex projects to completion;
  • Demonstrated success in managing org-wide L&D initiatives, ​​including navigating complex organizational landscapes and driving cross-functional collaboration with minimal oversight;
  • Experience in designing and implementing learning and development strategies that address diverse and evolving staff development needs;
  • Deep understanding of adult learning principles, facilitation techniques, and Learning Management Systems (LMS);
  • Strong facilitation skills and ability to design and deliver engaging learning experiences;
  • Experience in vendor management;
  • Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, with experience integrating these principles into L&D programs.
  • Versatility acting in both coordination and facilitation of training sessions;
  • Ability and willingness to travel as needed;
  • Fluent in written and spoken English.

Qualities that are important to us:

  • Familiarity with the free knowledge movement;
  • Experience in tech and/or not-for-profit organizations;
  • Experience working across different sociopolitical and cultural contexts;
  • Ability to adapt and pivot in complex environments.

The Wikimedia Foundation is the nonprofit organization that operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge freely. We host Wikipedia and the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. 

The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive donations from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

title: Senior Manager, Accounting
description:
Rithum™ is the world’s most trusted commerce network, accelerating how brands, suppliers, and retailers work together to deliver seamless e-commerce experiences. We provide an unmatched platform for brands and retailers, enabling them to accelerate growth, optimize operations across channels, scale product offerings and enhance margins.

Today, more than 40,000 companies trust Rithum to grow their business across hundreds of channels, representing over $50 billion in annual GMV. Using our commerce, marketing, and delivery solutions, our customers create optimized consumer shopping journeys from beginning to end.

 

Overview

As a Senior Manager, Accounting, reporting to the Senior Director, Accounting and Tax, you will be a key member of the finance team and responsible for ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of the financial close and reporting. You will lead the month end close process and be responsible for journal entry review, account reconciliations, and a timely close. title: Lead Business Analyst

title: Senior Program Manager

​Natera is a global leader in cell-free DNA (cfDNA) testing, specializing in oncology, women's health, and organ health. Leveraging a cutting-edge technology platform that combines novel molecular biology techniques with advanced bioinformatics software, Natera can detect down to a single molecule in a blood sample. This technology underpins a range of products, including Panorama™, a highly accurate noninvasive prenatal test; Signatera™, a tumor-specific assay for individualized cancer care; and Prospera™, a test for assessing rejection in kidney transplantation. ​

Founded in 2004 and headquartered in Austin, Texas, Natera operates CAP-accredited laboratories certified under the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) in both San Carlos, California, and Austin, Texas.
